column4: pepole! help. why my ubunty FF does make ssh connection to another machine in rather long time. what should I do?
how long does it take a ping request to be answered? is the network slow?
how long does it take to answer a ping?
though 15-20secs is too long in any case
0.8 ms
do both computers have ubuntu on them?
No, mothership runs opensuse10.2, and my wife's notebook I'm now typing runs ubuntu FF
a-ha. i once had this problem with an opensuse distribution. i've forgotten why it was... let me see what i can find out...
very interesting. I'll try another server
can you try connecting to the suse server with: "ssh -vvv <name of server> -l <name of account>"?
debug1: Local version string SSH-2.0-OpenSSH_4.3p2 Debian-8ubuntu1
have you seen my debug messages
okay, i have now :) i was researching, and i still am researching....
by the way, the same picture have been recently observed while connecting to FreeBSD ssh server
if you try to log in with the wrong username, how long does it take?
The same amount of time, at the same debug string. Then it queries a password 3 times and exits.
okay. i'm not getting anywhere by google. there are various suggestions about checking the dns settings on both computers.
dns works well. mothership runs NAT, notebook uses our provider's DNS. Queries are done in miliseconds.
And I make a connection directly by IP, directly to the mothership
maybe some options in /etc/ssh ?
you can have a look, but i can't find anything on google to help :(
Can I paste config to you?
i doubt i can help, if it's a configuration problem. have a look at the routing as well on both computers ("route")
Oh, routing works well. When I get connected, I issue scp command to copy a file, and it shows speed at 3.8MB/s
